channel.title: 2010–2011 Middle East and North Africa protests
channel.description: as you can see, protests and revolutions are happening all around the Arab world, including my country, what's your thoughts on these matters ? do you support the people who have been oppressed by dictators for decades or do you stand against the Idea ?

item.dc:creator: Dead_Phil
item.description:
yoyo278:

, isn’t it funny that these protests happened overnight in predominantly muslims countries?.

…Suttle racism there

item.source: 2010–2011 Middle East and North Africa protests

item.title: 2010–2011 Middle East and North Africa protests
item.dc:creator: yoyo278
item.description:
Tbh I can’t really this being anything other than a very intricate move more their natural resources by both the west and fat-cat monopolists within the middle east, isn’t it funny that these protests happened overnight in predominantly muslims countries? I’m all up for give each individual as much democracy as they need (aslong as it doesnt take away from other peoples democracy), but the fact that most of the public in these countries as simply protesting instead of putting through reforms is ridiculous.

I hope they sort it out soon though, regardless of for what reasons, countless (Over 9,000) deaths have been caused and need to be stopped.

Read full topic

item.title: 2010–2011 Middle East and North Africa protests
item.dc:creator: Bolteh
item.description:
Some dislike Mohammed VI, others praise him.

There were protests over there by both sides, and some Moroccans over here went to Brussels to QQ as well (silly, since they’re not in Morocco anymore, so whatever Mohammed VI does should have no effect in them).

Nothing major like I said, but who knows, it might ignite at some point.

Read full topic

item.title: 2010–2011 Middle East and North Africa protests
item.dc:creator: Jeannotvb
item.description:
The so called ‘invasion of Islam’ and terrorism is nothing but an illusion. The best way to control someone is through fear. And it has worked once again.

As far as the revolutions go, I support them.

Read full topic
item.source: 2010–2011 Middle East and North Africa protests

item.title: 2010–2011 Middle East and North Africa protests
item.dc:creator: Shadi
item.description:
Harun:

the signs are apparent! the downfalls of great empires, a dark shadow in the east, THE END IS NIGH!

i am sceptic about the situation down there. revolution, cool as it is, often “outdates” the revolutioners. before revolution is over the people who started it might see themselves with a new order they didn´t want. for example if some fundamental muslims take over control who think that freedom ain´t such a great thing after all.
i´m just exaggerating here, but you never know what you end up with when tearing down governments too fast.

what the west don’t want, is people practicing Islam. sadly cause they’re very “scared” of them blowing shit up

Read full topic
